description:
Allows the objects to be moved smoothly through smooth (bézier) curves across the scene.
Use *Append a path* to add a new destination point to the object. Use the action multiple times, to place multiple paths on the waiting line. They will all be played one by one.
The control points are used to distort the path line. Setting them to 0;0 and 0;0 will make the path line be straight.
Run the debug action every frame to see the control points in the scene.
name: CurvedMovement
shortDescription: Moves objects smoothly into specified positions through the use of Bézier curves.

eventsFunctions.description: Visualise a curve by creating a set number of objects on the curve.
eventsFunctions.name: VisualiseCurve
eventsFunctions.sentence: Visualise curve from _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ to _PARAM7_;_PARAM8_ (first control point: _PARAM9_;_PARAM10_, second control point: _PARAM11_;_PARAM12_) with easing _PARAM15_ (rotation: _PARAM13_ with offset _PARAM14_), by creating _PARAM2_ _PARAM1_s with _PARAM4_ opacity on layer _PARAM3_

events.comment: Create the set amount of objects the same way the movements are done

parameters: CurvedMovement::C_AngleOnCurve(GetArgumentAsNumber("StartPointX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("StartPointY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationPointX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationPointY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlPointX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlPointY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationControlPointX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationControlPointY"), GetArgumentAsString("Easing"), Variable(__CurvedMovement.ObjectsCreated) / GetArgumentAsNumber("ObjectAmount")) + GetArgumentAsNumber("RotationOffset")

eventsFunctions.description: X position of a curve on a point.
eventsFunctions.name: A_XposOnCurve

events.comment: Explanation is in the behavior "doStepPreEvents"

parameters: ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX") + 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlX")) + 3 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlX")) + (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX")

parameters.longDescription: From 0 to 1.
parameters.name: Progress

eventsFunctions.name: B_YposOnCurve

events.comment: Explanation is in the behavior "doStepPreEvents"

parameters: ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY") + 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlY")) + 3 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlY")) + (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY")

parameters.longDescription: From 0 to 1.
parameters.name: Progress

eventsFunctions.description: Angle of a curve on a point.
eventsFunctions.name: C_AngleOnCurve

events.comment: Explanation is in the behavior "doStepPreEvents"

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * ((GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlX")) - GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX")) + 6 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * ((GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlX")) - (GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlX"))) + 3 * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX") - (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlX"))), 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * ((GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlY")) - GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY")) + 6 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * ((GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlY")) - (GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("StartControlY"))) + 3 * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY") - (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY")+GetArgumentAsNumber("EndControlY"))))

parameters.longDescription: From 0 to 1.
parameters.name: Progress

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Moves the object to a specified position smoothly through the use of Bézier curves.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CurvedMovement

events.comment: Yes. That action there is somehow required. If I don't use tween somewhere in this code, the XposOnCurve, YposOnCurve, or the AngleOnCurve expressions break for no reason.
Timer variable
Set the StartPointX and StartPointY properties to the object X and Y positions.
PR = Progress (or "t"), S1 = Starting point, E1 = Ending point, S2 = First control point, E2 = Second control point.

Move the object
The formula that I used: ((1 - PR) * (1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * S1 + 3 * ((1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * PR * S2 + 3 * (1 - PR) * (PR * PR) * E2 + (PR * PR * PR) * E1

Rotate the object
The formula that I used: 3 * ((1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * (S2 - S1) + 6 * (1 - PR) * PR * (E2 - S2) + 3 * (PR * PR) * (E1 - E2)
If progress is over the duration, delete the first 10 variables, and set the object positions to the destination positions (to avoid any floating number errors)

eventsFunctions.description: Append a new path to the object. The object will finish moving through all previously added paths first.
eventsFunctions.name: A_AppendPath
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Append a new path to _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ (first control point: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, second control point: _PARAM6_;_PARAM7_) with easing _PARAM10_ over _PARAM11_ms. Rotate object: _PARAM8_ with _PARAM9_ offset

events.comment:
Append 10 variables to the end of an array variable. These are the values of the path that will be played.
0 = Destination X
1 = Destination Y
2 = Start control X (first control point) (saved as a relative)
3 = Start control Y (first control point) (saved as a relative)
4 = Destination control X (second control point) (saved as a relative)
5 = Destination control Y (second control point) (saved as a relative)
6 = Rotation enabled/disabled
7 = Rotation offset
8 = Easing (string)
9 = Duration (in miliseconds)

10 = Destination X for the second path
etc...

Note: Start XY doesn't get saved, because they will be set only when a new path begins.

eventsFunctions.description: Draw debug lines of a path of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Debug

events.comment: First (three gray) lines
Middle (two green) lines
Last (one blue) line
The curve
Starting and ending circles
Control point circles

parameters.longDescription: This object will be used to display the debug lines.
parameters.name: ShapePainter

eventsFunctions.description: Starting X point of a path at the specified index of an object. If the the object changes its position in between two paths, the number might be inaccurate.
eventsFunctions.name: C_StartX

events.comment: If the index equals 0, return the current start X position.

If the index is anything but 0, return the destination point of the previous paths destination point.
If a movement happens between the two paths, this number will be inaccurate.

parameters.longDescription: Index 0 is the path being played.
parameters.name: Index

eventsFunctions.description: Starting Y point of a path at the specified index of an object. If the the object changes its position in between two paths, the number might be inaccurate.
eventsFunctions.name: D_StartY

events.comment: If the index equals 0, return the current start Y position.

If the index is anything but 0, return the destination point of the previous paths destination point.
If a movement happens between the two paths, this number will be inaccurate.

parameters.longDescription: Index 0 is the path being played.
parameters.name: Index

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the starting points of the current path of an object.
The movement will be continued like if the new start point was used for the whole path. This will most likely result in teleporting the object to a different position.
eventsFunctions.name: B_ChangeStart
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Change the starting points of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the duration of the current path of an object.
The movement will be continued like if the new duration was used for the whole path. Unless the path progress is also changed, this will most likely result in teleporting the object to a different position.
eventsFunctions.name: I_ChangeDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Change the duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_. Also change the progress: _PARAM3_

events.comment: Apply the same multiplication to progress that was applied to duration

parameters.description: Also change the path progress relatively
parameters.longDescription: This will keep the object at the same position on the path, and will make the movement faster or slower.
parameters.name: ChangeProgress

eventsFunctions.description: The path progress of an object. Will return a number between 0 and 1.

parameters.longDescription: From 0 to 1.
